nodes.bodyText:
In the bnd file, this has to have a dot, as it doesn't seem to be able to handle the dash. I think I also copied this from another .feature file which did similar.
I'm also not sure what the purpose of that attribute is.

nodes.bodyText: This file is named incorrectly and the copyright date should probably be 2020?
I'm not sure that this error message is required since FFDC will automatically added. If it is needed then it should be NLS enabled.
Again, I don't think I'm adding anything useful, so I'll remove it
is MP Config 1.3 correct? Shouldn't it be at least 1.4?

nodes.bodyText: Is this a http or https?

http
https is unfortunately not yet supported in the implementation
Should be configurable then?

It will almost certainly need to be configurable once narayana supports https. However, as I don't know what their implementation will look like yet, I didn't think it was correct to add in liberty config that might have to change to fit in with the implementation
Why do you need metrics feature?

nodes.bodyText: Again, there will be an FFDC automatically added here to log the URISyntaxException. You then rethrow with a NLS enabled message. I don't think you need the extra error trace ... which would need to be NLS enabled anyway.
I don't think this is adding anything so I'll remove it
Add "file." to the end of the useraction so that it has "Correct the LRA coordinator configuration in the server.xml file."

+

+LRA_INVALID_COORDINATOR_URI.CWMRX5000E.explanation=LRA participants must be able to contact the coordinator.
+LRA_INVALID_COORDINATOR_URI.CWMRX5000E.useraction=Correct the LRA coordinator configuration in the server.xml

nodes.bodyText: Add a period to the end of the message so that it is "The LRA coordinator URI is not valid."

nodes.bodyText:
The info log level doesn't count as trace so it shouldn't be behind an isAnyTracingEnabled() guard and it needs to be translated.
Can be done as a follow up action.

This file appears to be unnecessary.
Can be done as a follow up action.

nodes.bodyText:
FYI,  you don't need to list features here which are in your server xml.
tested.features is to tell the build infrastructure that your test uses additional features not listed in server.xml (usually through @RepeatTests)
nodes.diffHunk:

+src: \
+	fat/src
+
+fat.project: true
+
+tested.features: mpLRA-1.0

nodes.bodyText: Stray comment

This is one place to define a trace group which the user can use to turn on trace for the whole feature rather than having to list package and class names. Elsewhere, you've used LRA as the tracegroup
I don't think you want this in the API bundle anyway since it won't have trace in it.
